unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically consider specific texts by Indigenous Australian people in the light of the above understandings.
Interpret and communicate the principles of current Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies guidelines to Indigenous community and professional audiences.
Justify your role as an Indigenous or non-Indigenous researcher or practitioner undertaking research or work with Indigenous communities.
Explain the principles of a range of Indigenous Research Methodologies appropriate for application in research with Indigenous peoples.
Critically reflect on current issues in Indigenous affairs and develop a proposal for small research project to address the problem.
Apply appropriate Indigenous Studies theoretical frameworks to resolve a range of ethical problems in Indigenous research.

enrolment_rules.description: (ABST1000 or ABST100) and (ABST2020 or ABST202 or ABST2060 or ABST2035)

assessments.description: This assessment task requires you to develop a research proposal. You will draw on your background research in the previous two assessment tasks.
In this task you will select one Indigenous research methods text from a list provided. You will be required to do a short presentation in class and submit a written review.
Active participation in weekly online tutorial activities. These will be available on a weekly basis on iLearn.

data.description: This unit examines contemporary and historical research practices and explores decolonising and Indigenist research methodologies. This unit also provides students with the skills and knowledge to engage in ethical research with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and communities. Students are guided by a range of documents outlining ethical research practices including, the Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander research guidelines, the National Health and Medical Research Council's, Values and Ethics: Guidelines for Ethical Conduct in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Research (Values and Ethics) and Macquarie University Ethics Approval process.
